am6vwq1m4.en: The learning route of Spring Boot can be carried out in the following stages, from the basics to the advanced level, gradually mastering the relevant skills. The following is a detailed route plan. 1. Java Basics (Essential prerequisites) 1. Core Syntax - Data types, flow Control, object-oriented programming (Encapsulation, inheritance, Polymorphism) - Collection Framework (List, Map, Set), exception handling, IO Flow 2. Java 8+ New Features - Lambda expressions, Stream API, Optional, time API (Local3). **Maven/Gradle** - Dependency management, project build, multiple ### ** II. Spring Framework 1. **Spring Core - IOC (Inversion of Control) and DI (Dependency Injection) - Bean lifecycle, scope (Singleton, Prot2). **Spring MVC - controller (@Controller), RESTful API design (@RestController - RequestMapping (@RequestMapping), Parameter Binding (@RequestParam, @Pathvariable) ### ** III. Spring Boot1. ** Introduction and Project Setup ** - Using [Spring Initializr](https://start.spring.io/) quick generation - understanding the principle of Auto-Configuration 2. ** core annotation - '@SpringBootApplication', '@Configuration', '@Bean -' @Autowired ', '@Component', '@Service', '@Repository3. ** Configuration file - 'application.properties'/' application - Multi-environment configuration (Profile) and external 4. **Web Development ** - Static resource processing, template engine (Thymeleaf/Freemarker) Interceptor, Filter 5. ** Data Access - Spring Data JPA (Hibernate) or My - Transaction Management (@Transactional), Pagination Query ### ** Four, Advanced Spring Boot 1. RESTful API - Unified Response Encapsulation, Global Exception Handling (@Controller - Interface Documentation Tool: Swagger/2. ** Security Control - Spring Security (Authentication and Authorization), JWT (Stateless Login) 3. ** Cache - Spring Cache Abstraction (Redis, C4. ** Message Queue ** - Integrated RabbitMQ/Kafka (asynchronous solution 5. Scheduled tasks ** - '@Scheduled', distributed task scheduling (Quartz/ XXl-job ### 5. Microservices and Cloud 1. Spring Cloud - Service registration and discovery (Eureka/ N-load balancing (Ribbon/OpenFeign), Gateway (Gateway/ Z-configuration center (Config/Nacos), circuit breaker (Hystrix/Sentinel2. **Docker and Kubernetes** - Containerized Deployment, writing Dockerfile - Basic concepts of Kubernetes (Pod, Deployment, Service3). ** Monitoring and Operations - Actuator Health Check, Prometheus + Grafana Monitoring ### ** VI. Project Practice and 1. Complete Project Development - Developing a Blog System, e-commerce Backend or OA - Technical Stack: Spring Boot + MyBatis + Redis +2. ** Performance Optimization ** - Database Index optimization, SQL invocation - Cache penetration/avalanche solution, Asynchronous 3. ** Testing and - Unit Testing (JUnit 5 + - CI/CD (Jenkins/ Github) ### ** Seven Extensions 1. ** Reactive Programming - Spring WebFlux (Reactive Programming) 2. **GraphQL** - An API query language to replace REST 3. ** Source Code Depth ** Reading Spring Boot startup process source (Spring# # # * * - * * document - [Spring Boot official documentation] books (https://spring.io/projects/spring- * * * * - the Spring "Boot Practice", "Spring Unveiling - ** Video - Bilibili/MOOCs Spring Boot Tutorial (Recommended: Shangguigu, Leishen - ** Community - Stack Overflow, Juejin, Spring Chinese Website ### ** Learning suggestions 1. ** Proceed step by step ** First, run the Demo thoroughly, and then delve deeper. 2. ** Hands-on practice ** : Each knowledge point is combined with small project exercises (for example, user 3. ** Participation in open source ** Read excellent projects on GitHub (such as' Spring-petcl '). Through the above route, you can systematically master Spring Boot within 3 to 6 months and expand in the direction of microservices or cloud-native according to your interests.

ljpghc1m5.en: The learning route of Spring Boot can be carried out in the following stages, from the basics to the advanced level, gradually mastering the relevant skills. The following is a detailed route plan. 1. Java Basics (Essential prerequisites) 1. Core Syntax - Data types, flow Control, object-oriented programming (Encapsulation, inheritance, Polymorphism) - Collection Framework (List, Map, Set), exception handling, IO Flow 2. Java 8+ New Features - Lambda expressions, Stream API, Optional, time API (Local3). **Maven/Gradle** - Dependency management, project build, multiple ### ** II. Spring Framework 1. **Spring Core - IOC (Inversion of Control) and DI (Dependency Injection) - Bean lifecycle, scope (Singleton, Prot2). **Spring MVC - controller (@Controller), RESTful API design (@RestController - RequestMapping (@RequestMapping), Parameter Binding (@RequestParam, @Pathvariable) ### ** III. Spring Boot1. ** Introduction and Project Setup ** - Using [Spring Initializr](https://start.spring.io/) quick generation - understanding the principle of Auto-Configuration 2. ** core annotation - '@SpringBootApplication', '@Configuration', '@Bean -' @Autowired ', '@Component', '@Service', '@Repository3. ** Configuration file - 'application.properties'/' application - Multi-environment configuration (Profile) and external 4. **Web Development ** - Static resource processing, template engine (Thymeleaf/Freemarker) Interceptor, Filter 5. ** Data Access - Spring Data JPA (Hibernate) or My - Transaction Management (@Transactional), Pagination Query ### ** Four, Advanced Spring Boot 1. RESTful API - Unified Response Encapsulation, Global Exception Handling (@Controller - Interface Documentation Tool: Swagger/2. ** Security Control - Spring Security (Authentication and Authorization), JWT (Stateless Login) 3. ** Cache - Spring Cache Abstraction (Redis, C4. ** Message Queue ** - Integrated RabbitMQ/Kafka (asynchronous solution 5. Scheduled tasks ** - '@Scheduled', distributed task scheduling (Quartz/ XXl-job ### 5. Microservices and Cloud 1. Spring Cloud - Service registration and discovery (Eureka/ N-load balancing (Ribbon/OpenFeign), Gateway (Gateway/ Z-configuration center (Config/Nacos), circuit breaker (Hystrix/Sentinel2. **Docker and Kubernetes** - Containerized Deployment, writing Dockerfile - Basic concepts of Kubernetes (Pod, Deployment, Service3). ** Monitoring and Operations - Actuator Health Check, Prometheus + Grafana Monitoring ### ** VI. Project Practice and 1. Complete Project Development - Developing a Blog System, e-commerce Backend or OA - Technical Stack: Spring Boot + MyBatis + Redis +2. ** Performance Optimization ** - Database Index optimization, SQL invocation - Cache penetration/avalanche solution, Asynchronous 3. ** Testing and - Unit Testing (JUnit 5 + - CI/CD (Jenkins/ Github) ### ** Seven Extensions 1. ** Reactive Programming - Spring WebFlux (Reactive Programming) 2. **GraphQL** - An API query language to replace REST 3. ** Source Code Depth ** Reading Spring Boot startup process source (Spring# # # * * - * * document - [Spring Boot official documentation] books (https://spring.io/projects/spring- * * * * - the Spring "Boot Practice", "Spring Unveiling - ** Video - Bilibili/MOOCs Spring Boot Tutorial (Recommended: Shangguigu, Leishen - ** Community - Stack Overflow, Juejin, Spring Chinese Website ### ** Learning suggestions 1. ** Proceed step by step ** First, run the Demo thoroughly, and then delve deeper. 2. ** Hands-on practice ** : Each knowledge point is combined with small project exercises (for example, user 3. ** Participation in open source ** Read excellent projects on GitHub (such as' Spring-petcl '). Through the above route, you can systematically master Spring Boot within 3 to 6 months and expand in the direction of microservices or cloud-native according to your interests.

evzsq1135.en: #Spring Boot Learning Route ## Basic Knowledge Stage 1. ** Consolidation of Java Basics ** - Core Features of Java8+ (Lambda, Stream API, etc.) - Object-oriented Programming Concepts - Collection Framework - Exception Handling - IO/NIO 2. **Maven/Gradle Build Tools ** - Dependency Management - Project Structure - Common Plugins 3. **Spring Framework Core ** - IoC Container -AOP Programming -Spring MVC - Transaction Management ## SpringBoot Core Learning 1. * * * * primer and foundation - Spring Boot introduction and advantages - the creation of the first Spring Boot applications - automatic configuration principle - the Starter rely on 2. * * - * * core feature configuration files (application. The properties/yaml) Profile Multi-environment Configuration - Log Configuration (Logback/SLF4J) - Conditional Annotation (@Conditional) 3.**Web Development ** -RESTful API Design - Controller (@RestController) - Request Mapping and Parameter Binding Static resource processing - Template Engine (Thymeleaf/FreeMarker) ## Data persistence 1. **Spring Data JPA** - Entity Mapping - Repository Interface - Query Methods - Pagination and sorting 2. **MyBatis/MyBatis-Plus** - XML and Annotation Configuration - Dynamic SQL - Associated Query 3. ** Database Connection ** - JDBC - Connection Pool (HikariCP) - Multi-data Source Configuration ## Advanced Features 1. ** Security Authentication ** - Spring Security Basics -OAuth2 -JWT Implementation 2.** Microservice-related ** - SpringCloud Introduction - Service Registration and Discovery (Eureka/Nacos) - Configuration Center - Service Invocation (Feign/RestTemplate) 3. ** Message Middleware ** - RabbitMQ Integration - Kafka Integration - Message Queue Mode 4. ** Cache Technology ** - Redis Integration - Cache Annotation (@Cacheable) - Distributed Lock ## Operation and Deployment 1.** Monitoring and Management ** Actuator Endpoint - Health Check - Custom Metrics 2. ** Testing ** - Unit Testing (JUnit 5) - Mock Testing (Mockito) - Integration Testing 3. ** Deployment ** - Packaging and Running (JAR/WAR) - Docker Containerization CI/CD Integration ## Practical Project Suggestions 1 Blog System 2. E-commerce System (Simplified Version) 3. Permission Management System 4 Instant Messaging System (Simplified Version) ## Learning Resource Recommendation - Official Documentation: [Spring Boot ReferenceGuide] (https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/htmlsingle/) - books: "Spring Boot in Practice", "Spring Boot Programming Thought" - Online courses: Bilibili, MOOC, Coursera Related courses - Community: Spring Official Forum, StackOverflow, Juejin, CSDN ## Advanced Directions - Source Code Analysis - Performance Optimization - Architecture Design - Reactive Programming (WebFlux) Learn step by step along this route, while practicing with actual projects Be able to systematically master the development skills of Spring Boot.

jokgtb13b.en: Spring Boot Learning ## I. Basic Stage ### 1.- Master Java Core Syntax - Understand object-oriented Programming - Be familiar with collection framework, IO Stream, multithreading, etc.- New Features of JDK8+ (Lambda expression, Stream API) ### 2. Spring Framework Basics - Understanding IoC(Inversion of Control) and DI(- Learning Spring Core Modules (Beans) Core- Understanding AOP(Aspect-Oriented Programming) - Spring### 3. Spring- Introduction to Spring Boot - Creating the First Spring Boot Project - Understanding Auto-configuration - Using Spring Initial- Understanding Spring Boot Starter## II. Core Skills ### 1. Web- RESTful API- Controller - Request Processing and Response - Parameter Verification (- Exception Handling - File Upload and Download) 2. Data access - Spring Data JPA- MyBatis/MyBatis-Plus Integration - Database Migration tools (Flyway/Liquibase- Redis integration - MongoDB integration) Configuration Management - Multi-environment configuration (dev/test- Externalized configuration - @ConfigurationProperties usage - Configuration refresh (Spring Cloud Config### 4) Security Control - Spring Security Basics - Authentication and Authorization - JWT Implementation - OAuth2.0(- CSRF Protection) ## III. Advanced Content ### 1. Microservice-related - Spring Cloud Basics - Service Registration and Discovery (Eureka/N- Load balancing (R- Declarative REST Client) (Feign- Gateway (Gateway) - Distributed Configuration Center - Circuit Breaking and Rate Limiting (Hystrix/S) ### 2. Message - RabbitMQ-Kafka Integration (Optional - Reliable Messages ### 3 Cache Technology - Spring-Redis Cache Implementation - Cache Consistency ### 4. Test-related - Unit Testing (JUnit5- Mock Testing (M- Integration - Test Coverage (JA) ## 4. Operations and Deployment ### 1. Monitoring and Management - Actuator Endpoint - Health - Metric Monitoring (P- Link Tracing (Sleuth+### 2. Container - Docker Basics - Dockerfile Writing - Docker- Kubernetes Basics ### 3. Deployment Method - Traditional jar- Cloud-Native - CI/CD Flow ## Five, Best ### 1. Project - layered modular development - # # # 2. Performance -- the JVM tuning SQL cache - asynchronous # # # 3. Design - design pattern commonly used in the application of Spring - Spring typical pattern # # # # # learning resources official - [Spring Boot official documentation] (HTTP: / / https://spring.io/projects/spring-boot- / Spring Framework document] (https://spring.io/projects/spring-framework### books - "Spring Boot -" Spring micro service actual combat - "Spring reveal official tutorial - # # # - Spring Bilibili/MOOC/Geek Time related ### Practical suggestions: 1. Start with simple projects and gradually increase. 2. Participate in open source projects or build a complete one by yourself. 3. Keep the coding habit and study systematically along this route for at least one hour every day. Practice with actual projects, and you can gradually master the Spring Boot development skills.
